Topic.Title: Any other way to publish my Game?

Posts.EditableText: My Textadventure is filled with gif's and music and it is way to big to upload. Is there any other way I can publish my game? Im open for ANY ideas!
Posts.HTML: My Textadventure is filled with gif's and music and it is way to big to upload. Is there any other way I can publish my game? Im open for ANY ideas!

Posts.EditableText:
Could you put the images and music on another web site, and have your game load them from there?

May be worth looking at compressing them more?
Posts.HTML:
Could you put the images and music on another web site, and have your game load them from there?

May be worth looking at compressing them more?

Posts.EditableText:
I think I understand what you mean, but that would break the "Immersion" of the game :/
And compressing want help at this point
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: You can link to images at another website, but still have them appear in your game just as they normally do. The `Picture` command just inserts an HTML `img` element, and that can reference an image anywhere. For example (in code): ``` msg("") ``` There is some information on using `img` here, though it is not quite what you want to do: https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Images-Part-01:-Basic-techniques
Posts.HTML:
You can link to images at another website, but still have them appear in your game just as they normally do. The Picture command just inserts an HTML img element, and that can reference an image anywhere. For example (in code):

msg("<img src=\"http://mydomain/images/myimage.png\" />")

There is some information on using img here, though it is not quite what you want to do:
https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Images-Part-01:-Basic-techniques
